alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 3:06PM MDT until March 26 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW ON THE NORTHEAST PLAINS... .An area of snow will move across northeastern Colorado today, with the snow lingering into tonight in the northeast corner. The heaviest snow this morning will move from Weld county across Morgan county. For this afternoon and evening, it will shift to Sterling and Akron and areas further east and northeast. The snow will be heavy at times and will produce snow covered roads and limited visibilities. In areas west of Sterling and Akron, conditions should improve this afternoon. Further east there may be some help with highways from warm temperatures this afternoon, but icy and snow covered roads will be likely this evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to four inches, with the heaviest totals falling in Sedgwick and Phillips counties. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Sterling, Akron, Julesburg, and Holyoke. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Visibility will be limited in areas of heavy snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Consider avoiding travel during the period of heaviest snow this afternoon and evening, especially in remote areas. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
